title: JSON Text
description: A text snippet to generate an image with using json-text2png.py.

text.description: The text to render. Use `\n` for line breaks.

width.description: The output image width in pixels.

font-family.description: The CSS font family name to use. This needs to be installed on your system.

font-size.description: The font size in pixels to use.

line-height.description: line height in pixels without unit, "normal", **or** percentage of font-size, with percentage unit, eg: `"line-height": 72` or `"line-height": "120%"`

font-weight.description: [Optional]: CSS font weight number. Default is `400`.

align.description: How to horizontally justify the text (valid values: "start", "middle", "end").

baseline.description: [Optional]: In case the font has issues with vertical centering, you can try changing this to 'middle'. This corresponds to the 'dominant-baseline' svg property (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/dominant-baseline) Note that I don't really understand how this property works... Default is "central" (I recommend sticking to this unless you encounter vertical alignment problems).

y-offset.description: [Optional]: An extra offset in pixels. The text will be shifted *down* by this amount. May be negative. This is useful for bad behaving fonts which are not properly vertically aligned.
